description: Mid 17th century borrowed from Ancient Greek ὠτῐκός (ōtikós, “of or for the ear”), from οὖς (oûs, “ear”) +‎ -ῐκός (-ikós, “-ic”, adjectival suffix).

entries.meaning: (anatomy) Of, relating/pertaining to, or located near the ear.
examples: Otic preparations are used to treat infections of the ear canal.
